4.text: These people are amongst the greatest quiz players in Britain.

9.text: Together, they make up the Eggheads,

11.text: arguably the most formidable quiz team in the country.

17.text: The question is, can they be beaten?

23.text: Welcome to Eggheads, the show where a team of five quiz Challengers

27.text: pit their wits against possibly the greatest quiz team in Britain.

33.text: And taking on the might of our quiz Goliaths

36.text: are Run Camden from London. This team of friends met

40.text: through their shared love of running

42.text: and regularly pound the pavements of north London together.

46.text: Hi, I'm Sam. I'm the manager of a running shop.

49.text: Hi, I'm John and I'm the assistant manager of a running shop.

53.text: Hi, I'm Emma and I'm studying for a PhD in neuromuscular diseases.

57.text: Hi, I'm Jonny and I'm an insurance claims handler.

59.text: Hi, I'm Charlotte and I'm a projects manager for a theatre company.

63.text:
- So, Sam, team, welcome. 
- Hello. 
- Good to see you.

66.text:
- You run together, do you? 
- That's right, yeah.

69.text: Every single week... John and I are there every week

72.text: and the others are there almost every week.

75.text: When I said you pound the pavements of north London,

77.text: I think that's not easy cos there's a lot of people on those pavements.

80.text: There's a lot of parks, there's a lot of different places that we go -

84.text: Hampstead Heath, lots of lovely places to run.

86.text:
- And you are quizzers, some of you. 
- In theory. 
- OK, I won't ask any more.

93.text: up for grabs for our Challengers.

95.text: However, if they fail to defeat the Eggheads,

97.text: the prize money rolls over to the next show.

101.text: that the Eggheads have been on a bit of a marathon here,

104.text: doing really well, stayed on their feet.

108.text: so that means there's £19,000 to play for today. How's that?

- That should be perfect.

- I'm OK but John's a little bit better.

150.text: would you please both take your positions in our Question Room?

160.text: and then spent some time in Portugal

162.text: before coming back to Scotland, so well travelled.

170.text: so he was based out in a few different countries

173.text: and he happened to be in Cuba when I was on the way.

176.text: 30 years ago, they were really a hot topic.

179.text: Yeah, certainly it was quite an interesting place to work.

182.text: I've been back a couple of times and it's certainly quite a place.

188.text: so running is your sport. Anything else?

194.text: I know a lot about football but not very good at it.

- So, Sport, John, your choice - first or second?

253.text: Er, 2015... Now, I think Chris Hoy's that little bit younger

- Oh, who isn't?

289.text: So I've said one work to him, literally one word.

1522.text: Achilles is right. Oh, this is a good competition today!

1528.text: Eggheads, third question. Get this wrong

1530.text: and all they have to do is get the next one right.

1532.text: The site of the 1746 Battle of Culloden

1536.text: is located near which Scottish city?

1542.text: It was at Drumlochy Moor, just outside Inverness.

1544.text:
- Yeah. 
- Inverness, yeah. 
- That's definitely Inverness.

1548.text: It is definitely Inverness. Well done. You've got three out of three.

1553.text: Giving them chance to go first means

1554.text: they put you under pressure, so you have to get this one right

1557.text: or the contest is over. Take your time. Here it is.

1561.text: Every year, the Duke of Marlborough and the Duke of Wellington

1565.text: each present the Crown with which item

1567.text: as a symbolic rent for their country estate?

1578.text:
- Any confident ideas? 
- Both famous soldiers.

1581.text: I would confidently discount the French flag.

1584.text:
- Who would want a French flag? 
- Barrel of sherry sticks out to me.

1588.text:
- I don't know. 
- See, I don't know. I was edging towards cannon ball.

1592.text: I'd say, on the basis of them both being...

1595.text: their ancestors being the most famous soldiers.

1599.text:
- Cannon ball jumps out. 
- Well, none of us know.

1602.text:
- Why does barrel of sherry jump out to you? 
- Cos he likes sherry.

1605.text: I just think it's barrel of sherry but there's two of you

1607.text: and there's one of me. Two of you, one of me.

1610.text: A 19-grand punt on a cannon ball.

1615.text: Yeah, we've not got a huge amount to go on

1618.text: and it's probably going to be French flag now, but cannon ball.

1621.text: OK, cannon ball, you say, and if you get this wrong, the contest is over.

1627.text: I guess there aren't that many cannon balls around.

1629.text: I have got a memory of a barrel of sherry in this, somehow.

1632.text: Do you know the answer, Eggheads?

1634.text: No, but they both had famous victories against the French,

1637.text:
- so I'd be tempted for French flag. 
- It would be too tactless.

1641.text: I think it would be too insensitive, a French flag.

1644.text: As you can see, this is not easy

1646.text: but you've given a reason for French flag.

1648.text:
- The answer is French flag. 
- No!

1650.text:
- Seriously. 
- Yes, I thought so. 
- I'm amazed.

1652.text: Barry would have got that but Judith might have stopped him.

1655.text:
- I'd have stopped him. 
- You wouldn't have.

1659.text:
- Ah, if only we'd gone the other way round. 
- We'd have argued.

1661.text: I'm sorry, Challengers. After a great contest,

1663.text: we have to say congratulations, Eggheads, you have won.

1672.text: Yeah, they did both have famous victories against the French,

1674.text: so it was that one sliver of information

1677.text: that might have led you there, but very hard.

1682.text: Great contest. Really brilliant watching it from here, thank you.

1685.text: The Eggheads have done what comes naturally to them.

1689.text: You don't have to put up with any of my training shoe jokes now,

1694.text: You won't be going home with the £19,000, back to Camden,

1697.text: so that means the money rolls over to our next show.

1699.text: Eggheads, congratulations. You are now officially unbeatable.

1702.text:
- You can never, never be beaten. 
- Don't say that, please!

1705.text: I'm tempting it! Join us next time

1707.text: to see if a new team of Challengers have the brains to take them apart.

1711.text: My goodness, Run Camden nearly did today.

1713.text: It's going to be £20,000 they're playing for next time.
